Description: A large, evergreen tree with a dense, rounded crown. Known for its pest-repelling properties and tolerance to drought.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Highly drought-tolerant once established. Can be propagated from seeds or root suckers. Requires minimal watering.

Description: An aromatic perennial plant, considered sacred in Hinduism. It's an erect, much-branched subshrub with hairy stems and simple green or purple leaves.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in full sun and well-drained, fertile soil. Water regularly but avoid waterlogging. Can be grown from seeds or cuttings. Prune regularly to encourage bushy growth.

Description: A herbaceous perennial plant known for its bright orange rhizome, which is used as a popular spice. It has large, oblong leaves.
Growing_Tips: Requires well-drained, loamy soil and a warm, humid climate with significant rainfall. Plant rhizome pieces in spring. Prefers partial shade.

Description: A small, woody shrub with dull green leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that produce an orange-red fruit. Known as an adaptogen.
Growing_Tips: Grows well in dry, sandy, or loamy soil with good drainage. Prefers full sun. It is drought-resistant and requires minimal watering once established.

Description: A creeping, non-aromatic herb with succulent leaves. It commonly grows in marshy areas and wetlands.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in wet, boggy soil and can even grow hydroponically or in aquariums. Requires full sun to partial shade and consistent moisture; must not be allowed to dry out. Propagate easily from stem cuttings.

Description: A succulent plant species with thick, fleshy, green to grey-green leaves with serrated margins. The gel inside the leaves is widely used.
Growing_Tips: Prefers sandy, well-draining soil and bright, indirect sunlight. Highly drought-tolerant; water deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out completely between waterings.

Description: A herbaceous perennial whose rhizome is widely used as a spice. It grows annual pseudostems and has narrow, blade-like leaves.
Growing_Tips: Prefers rich, loamy, well-drained soil and a warm, humid climate with partial shade. Plant rhizome pieces with growth buds pointing up. Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged during the growing season.

Description: A large, deciduous climbing shrub with a succulent stem and heart-shaped leaves. It often grows on other trees and produces long, slender aerial roots.
Growing_Tips: Extremely easy to grow. Thrives in a variety of soils but prefers well-drained loam. Can be propagated easily from stem cuttings. Needs a support structure to climb. Drought-tolerant once established.

Description: A small to medium-sized deciduous tree with feathery leaves and small, round, greenish-yellow fruits known for their high vitamin C content.
Growing_Tips: Prefers deep, fertile, well-drained loamy soil. Requires full sun. Can tolerate moderate drought but fruits better with regular watering.

Description: An annual plant with leaves consisting of three small obovate to oblong leaflets. It produces seeds that are a common spice.
Growing_Tips: Grows best in well-drained, loamy soil in a sunny location. Sow seeds directly in the garden in spring. Requires moderate watering.

Description: A large, evergreen tree with a spreading crown and smooth, grey bark. Often found growing on the banks of rivers or dry riverbeds.
Growing_Tips: Prefers alluvial loamy soil and requires plenty of sunlight. Can tolerate some waterlogging. Propagated from seeds, which should be soaked before planting.

Description: A traditional Ayurvedic formulation made from the dried fruits of three plants: Amalaki (Phyllanthus emblica ), Bibhitaki (Terminalia bellirica), and Haritaki (Terminalia chebula). It is not a single plant.
Growing_Tips: Cultivation involves growing the three constituent trees separately. Each has its own specific growing requirements.

Description: A perennial herb with a woody rootstock and numerous prostrate branches. It has small, white to pale pink flowers.
Growing_Tips: Grows well in sandy or loamy, well-drained soil. Prefers full sun and is highly drought-tolerant. Often found in open, grassy areas.

Description: A climbing plant with a woody stem and needle-like leaves (cladodes ). It produces small, white flowers and has a tuberous root system.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil and partial shade. Propagated through root divisions or seeds. Requires regular watering and a support to climb on.

Description: An annual herbaceous plant with a bitter taste. It has slender stems, lance-shaped leaves, and small white flowers with purple markings.
Growing_Tips: Grows in most soil types but prefers fertile, well-drained soil. Needs partial shade. Propagated by seeds. Keep the soil consistently moist.

Description: A perennial woody vine known as the 'sugar destroyer'. It has elongated-oval leaves and climbs on other vegetation.
Growing_Tips: Requires bright, indirect light and well-draining loamy soil. Water when the soil is almost dry. Can be propagated from stem cuttings or seeds, though seeds can be challenging. Prefers a warm, humid environment.

Description: A perennial climbing plant with long, cylindrical roots that have a red bark. The stems are quadrangular and have small hooks to help it climb.
Growing_Tips: Prefers loose, moist, loamy soil rich in humus and some shade. Can be propagated by seeds or root cuttings/divisions. Needs a support structure to climb.

Description: A perennial creeping herb with a deep, stout taproot. It has spreading branches and small, pink or reddish flowers.
Growing_Tips: A hardy weed that grows in a variety of soils. Prefers full sun. Highly drought-tolerant. Propagates easily from seeds.

Description: An annual herb that commonly grows in moist places. It has weak, reddish stems and small, white, daisy-like flowers.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in moist to wet, fertile soil. Prefers full sun to partial shade. Can be grown from seeds or cuttings. Often considered a weed in agricultural settings.

Description: A small perennial herb growing in the Himalayan region. It has a long, creeping rhizome and serrated leaves.
Growing_Tips: Requires moist, sandy loam soil rich in organic matter. Prefers a cool, temperate climate and partial shade. Difficult to cultivate outside its native high-altitude habitat.

Description: A flowering plant native to the Himalayas, known for its aromatic rhizomes. It is a perennial herb with pink, bell-shaped flowers.
Growing_Tips: Grows in cool, temperate, high-altitude regions. Prefers well-draining, slightly acidic soil rich in organic matter. Requires partial sun and consistent moisture. Propagation is by seed (which needs stratification ) or rhizome division.

Description: A herbaceous plant with tuberous roots and lanceolate leaves. It produces small, white flowers on a long stalk.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained, sandy loam soil. Requires a warm, humid climate with a distinct rainy season for growth. Propagated through its fleshy roots.

Description: A large, scandent shrub with slender, brittle stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. It produces small, globular, reddish to black fruits.
Growing_Tips: Grows in evergreen forests and requires humus-rich, moist soil. Prefers a semi-shaded environment. Propagated from seeds or stem cuttings.

Description: A medium to large deciduous tree with a rounded crown and dark brown bark. It produces yellowish-white flowers and a drupe-like fruit.
Growing_Tips: Grows in various soils but prefers loose, well-drained sandy loam. Requires full sun and a tropical environment. Propagated from seeds, which may need pre-treatment to improve germination.

Description: A perennial shrub, often with a rambling or climbing habit. It has ovate leaves and produces spikes of white, tubular flowers.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. It is drought-tolerant once established. Can be propagated from seeds, cuttings, or root division.

Description: A small to medium-sized tree with trifoliate leaves and hard, woody fruits. Sacred to Lord Shiva in Hinduism.
Growing_Tips: Tolerates various soil types but prefers well-drained loamy soil. Drought-tolerant once established. Propagated from seeds or grafting.

Description: A large evergreen tree with dark purple fruits. The seeds are particularly valued for diabetes management.
Growing_Tips: Prefers deep, fertile, well-drained soil. Requires full sun. Can tolerate flooding and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.

Description: An evergreen tree with aromatic bark that is harvested as the spice cinnamon. Has oval-shaped leaves with distinctive veining.
Growing_Tips: Requires humid, tropical climate with well-drained, fertile soil. Prefers partial shade when young, full sun when mature.

Description: A herbaceous perennial with large, blade-like leaves and small white flowers followed by green seed pods.
Growing_Tips: Requires shade, high humidity, and well-drained, organic-rich soil. Needs consistent moisture and protection from strong winds.

Description: A flowering vine in the family Piperaceae, cultivated for its fruit which is dried and used as a spice and seasoning.
Growing_Tips: Requires hot, humid climate with well-drained, fertile soil. Needs support to climb and partial shade.

Description: An evergreen tree with aromatic flower buds that are harvested when pink and dried until they turn brown.
Growing_Tips: Requires tropical climate with high humidity, well-drained soil, and partial shade. Needs consistent moisture.

Description: An evergreen tree cultivated for two spices derived from its seed: nutmeg from the seed itself and mace from the seed covering.
Growing_Tips: Requires hot, humid tropical climate with rich, well-drained soil and partial shade. Needs high humidity and protection from wind.

Description: A flowering vine with cylindrical fruit spikes that are dried and used medicinally and as a spice.
Growing_Tips: Prefers moist, shaded locations with rich, well-drained soil. Needs support to climb and high humidity.

Description: A small tree with aromatic, pinnately compound leaves that are widely used in Indian cooking and traditional medicine.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained, fertile soil and full sun to partial shade. Regular watering needed, especially during dry periods.

Description: A herbaceous, perennial plant with kidney-shaped leaves and small white or pink flowers. Grows in wetlands.
Growing_Tips: Thrives in moist, shaded areas with rich, organic soil. Can be grown in water gardens or as ground cover in humid conditions.

Description: A tropical vine with distinctive warted, bitter fruits that are used both as food and medicine.
Growing_Tips: Requires warm climate, well-drained soil, and full sun. Needs support for climbing and regular watering during growing season.

Description: A shrub with heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. All parts of the plant have medicinal uses.
Growing_Tips: Grows in various soil types but prefers well-drained soil. Tolerates drought and requires full sun to partial shade.

Description: An erect shrub with heart-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. Known for its strengthening properties.
Growing_Tips: Grows in poor soils and dry conditions. Prefers full sun and is drought-tolerant once established.

Description: A small thorny tree producing small, round fruits that change from green to reddish-brown when ripe.
Growing_Tips: Very drought-tolerant and adaptable to poor soils. Prefers full sun and minimal water once established.

Description: A medium-sized tree with pinnate leaves and clusters of white, pink, or purple flowers followed by brown seed pods.
Growing_Tips: Tolerates saline soils and coastal conditions. Prefers full sun and is drought-tolerant once established.

Description: A small tree or shrub with large, glossy leaves and distinctive knobby white fruits with a strong odor.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Tolerates various soil types and some drought.

Description: A slender, twining shrub with fragrant roots that have a vanilla-like scent. Used as a substitute for sarsaparilla.
Growing_Tips: Grows in various soil types, prefers partial shade. Drought-tolerant once established. Propagated from root cuttings.

Description: A herbaceous plant with tuberous roots and lanceolate leaves. It produces small, white flowers on a long stalk.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained, sandy loam soil. Requires a warm, humid climate with a distinct rainy season for growth. Propagated through its fleshy roots.

Description: A perennial climbing plant with long, cylindrical roots that have a red bark. The stems are quadrangular and have small hooks to help it climb.
Growing_Tips: Prefers loose, moist, loamy soil rich in humus and some shade. Can be propagated by seeds or root cuttings/divisions. Needs a support structure to climb.

Description: A fast-growing tree with compound leaves and long, slender seed pods. All parts are edible and highly nutritious.
Growing_Tips: Grows in poor soils and dry conditions. Extremely drought-tolerant and fast-growing. Prefers full sun and well-drained soil.

Description: A small to medium-sized deciduous tree with feathery leaves and small, round, greenish-yellow fruits known for their high vitamin C content.
Growing_Tips: Prefers deep, fertile, well-drained loamy soil. Requires full sun. Can tolerate moderate drought but fruits better with regular watering.

Description: A medium-sized tree with papery bark that produces aromatic resin used in traditional medicine and incense.
Growing_Tips: Grows in rocky, arid areas. Extremely drought-tolerant and prefers poor, well-drained soils. Requires full sun.

Description: A small, thorny shrub that produces aromatic gum resin. The resin is tapped from cuts in the bark.
Growing_Tips: Grows in arid, rocky areas. Extremely drought-tolerant and requires minimal care. Prefers sandy, well-drained soil.

Description: A medium-sized tree with bright yellow flowers in long, drooping clusters followed by long, dark brown pods.
Growing_Tips: Tolerates various soil types but prefers well-drained soil. Drought-tolerant once established. Requires full sun.

Description: A tall evergreen tree with fragrant white flowers and iron-hard wood. The flowers are particularly valued in medicine.
Growing_Tips: Requires humid climate with well-drained, fertile soil. Prefers partial shade and consistent moisture.

Description: A large, evergreen tree with a dense, rounded crown. Known for its pest-repelling properties and tolerance to drought.
Growing_Tips: Prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Highly drought-tolerant once established. Can be propagated from seeds or root suckers. Requires minimal watering.

Description: A large evergreen tree that produces aromatic resin used in traditional medicine and religious ceremonies.
Growing_Tips: Requires humid climate with well-drained, fertile soil. Prefers partial shade and high humidity.

Description: A medium-sized tree with bright red flowers and thorny branches. Often used as a shade tree and ornamental plant.
Growing_Tips: Tolerates various soil types including sandy soils. Prefers full sun and is moderately drought-tolerant.

Description: A large deciduous tree with smooth bark that peels off in irregular flakes. Has simple, alternate leaves.
Growing_Tips: Grows in various soil types and climates. Drought-tolerant once established. Prefers full sun to partial shade.

Description: A large deciduous tree with smooth bark that peels off in irregular flakes. Has simple, alternate leaves.
Growing_Tips: Grows in various soil types and climates. Drought-tolerant once established. Prefers full sun to partial shade.
